text: The Atari Jaguar was a video game machine released by Atari in 1993. It was not a successful product and was Atari's last console. It also had a CD-based accessory called the Atari Jaguar CD. The Jaguar had three CPUs, one of which was a 16-bit Motorola 68000, and two of which were 32-bit. Atari marketed it as a 64-bit console, even though it did not have a 64-bit CPU. The Atari Jaguar was sold at about the same time as the PlayStation, Sega Saturn and Nintendo 64, but it was not very popular as it did not have as many popular games as these other consoles. The graphics of Atari Jaguar games look a lot like the Sega Genesis, Sega Mega Drive or SNES games as it did not run 3D games as well as the Sega Saturn or PlayStation. == References == Category:Video game consoles Category:Atari hardware
title: Atari Jaguar
